alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued November 29 at 4:51AM PST until November 30 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. * WHERE...Spokane Valley, Harrington, Davenport, Ritzville, Grand Coulee, Cheney, Creston, Fairfield, Rockford, Wilbur, Odessa, Coulee City, Downtown Spokane, and Airway Heights. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until noon PST today. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 11 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. Temperatures below freezing will lead to slick roads especially over bridges and lesser traveled roads. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Buildup of fine pollution particles can be harmful to those sensitive to air pollution including people with lung and heart problems, people with diabetes, children and the elderly.
